title: Training-Free Condition Video Diffusion Models for single frame Spatial-Semantic Echocardiogram Synthesis
details: VP Nguyen, TNL Ha, HH Pham, QL Tran - arXiv preprint arXiv:2408.03035, 2024
abstract: Conditional video diffusion models (CDM) have shown promising results for video synthesis, potentially enabling the generation of realistic echocardiograms to address the problem of data scarcity. However, current CDMs require a paired …

title: To Slide or Not to Slide: That Is the Question
abstract: The evaluation of pneumothorax has always been not only one of the most fascinating but also one of the most debated fields of lung ultrasound scanning (LUS). The idea that a simple and repeatable imaging test, such as ultrasound, can …

title: An Automated Pipeline for the Identification of Liver Tissue in Ultrasound Video
details: ES Ockenden, S Mpooya, JA Noble, GF Chami - medRxiv, 2024
abstract: Liver diseases are a leading cause of death worldwide, with an estimated 2 million deaths each year. Causes of liver disease are diffi-cult to ascertain, especially in sub- Saharan Africa where there is a high prevalence of infectious diseases such as …
